definitions.definition: To utter a sudden and loud cry, as in joy, triumph, exultation or anger, or to attract attention, to animate others, etc.
To utter with a shout; to cry; to shout out
definitions.example: They shouted his name to get his attention.

definitions.definition: To pay for food, drink or entertainment for others.
definitions.example: He′s shouting us all to the opening night of the play.

definitions.definition: To post a text message (for example, email) in upper case, regarded as the electronic messaging equivalent of oral shouting.
definitions.example: Please don't shout in the chat room.

definitions.definition: To treat with shouts or clamor.
The action of the verb to shout.
